article:
}}

'David James Archuleta' (born December 28, 1990) is an American singer-
songwriter and actor. At ten years old, he won the children's division of the
Utah Talent Competition leading to other television singing appearances. When he was twelve years old, Archuleta became the Junior Vocal
Champion on [[Star Search|Star Search 2]]. In 2007, at
sixteen years old, he became one of the youngest contestants on the seventh
season of [[American Idol]]. In May 2008 he finished
as the runner-up, receiving 44 percent of over 97 million votes.

In August 2008 Archuleta released "Crush", the first single from his self-titled
debut album.
 The album, released three months
later, debuted at number two on the ''Billboard'' 200 chart; it has sold over
750,000 copies in the U.S., and over 900,000 worldwide. [http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/30573/chart-watch-extra-
the-american-idol-alumni-association/ Chart Watch], Yahoo.com
In October 2010 he released a third album, [[The Other Side of Down]] featuring
lead single "Something 'Bout Love". On March 28, 2012, Archuleta left on a two-
year hiatus to be a missionary of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day
Saints in Chile, but he will continue his music career after that. As of February 2012, Archuleta has sold
1,108,000 albums and 3,327,000 tracks in the United States. [http://www.billboard.com/#/features/top-24-american-idols-of-all-
time-1004088662.story?page=3 Top 24 'American Idol' Of All-Time]

In March 2012, Archuleta released his fourth album, [[Forevermore (David
Archuleta album)|Forevermore]], exclusively in the Philippines only. This was
his first Original Pilipino Music album, composed of several covers of Filipino
songs. The album was certified gold in the Philippines (10,000 units) as of June
2012.

Archuleta's fifth album, [[Begin (David Archuleta album)|Begin]], was released
on August 7, 2012, in the United States. Sixth album, No Matter How Far is
anticipated for release on March 26, 2013.
